pr_title: Fix up toolbar buttons and commands

timeline.message:
properly display buttons on toolbar on start up and
allow specified buttons to not be synced with their toolbar

timeline.bodyText: I'd love a comment briefly describing what "synced" means, even just a single-line // foo bar style here.
timeline.author: gtritchie
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -40,24 +40,32 @@ public CommandSourceColumnToolbarButton(SourceAppCommand sourceCmd,
                                               String buttonLabel,
                                               String buttonTitle,
                                               ImageResourceProvider imageResourceProvider,
-                                              ClickHandler clickHandler)
+                                              ClickHandler clickHandler,
+                                              boolean synced)

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not a big fan of boolean arguments like these (though I know we do it a lot, and I've written a bunch of code that does it, too). So this is absolutely just me thinking out loud, no real need to change anything.
Alternatives include creating a separate method, e.g.
.createUnsyncedToolbarButton()
Commenting the argument:
.createToolbarButton(false/*synced*/)
Pass an enum, instead (public enum SyncType { UNSYNCED, SYNCED }).
timeline.author: gtritchie

replies.bodyText: I like .createUnsyncedToolbarButton and switched to that.
replies.author: melissa-barca

timeline.message: rename function to make calls more clear
